meanings.definition: Disquantities: to reduce the amount or number of something
meanings.sent1: She disquantities her toy collection to make space for new ones.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disquantities the homework load to help students manage their time better.
meanings.sent3: He disquantities his snack supply, leaving only a few cookies for himself.
meanings.sent4: The gardener disquantities the overgrown bushes, shaping them into neat hedges.
meanings.sent5: The chef disquantities the ingredients, carefully measuring each one for the recipe.

meanings.definition: Disquantities: a small or insufficient amount of something
meanings.sent1: She only had disquantities of time to finish her project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The beggar asked for help, explaining he had disquantities of food left.
meanings.sent3: The tiny jar contained disquantities of glitter, but it was enough for the craft.
meanings.sent4: The explorer found disquantities of water in the desert, just enough to survive.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper displayed disquantities of rare stamps in the antique store.
